review:
한국에서도 서비스 했었던 피망 사이트 라는 에서 오픈했던 은하대전 진짜 연령 제한 없이 모두가 즐기던 게임이었습니다.
하지만 무슨이유로 서비스종료 했는지 몰랐기에 은하대전 서비스 종료 이후로 참 여러 게임에 뛰어들었는데..
스팀에 있어서 해보려고 했는데 브라우저 로딩이 너무 느려서 브라우저 접속이 불가능합니다.
아니면 운영을 안하는걸지도 모르죠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11207, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1635066002}
review:
BattleSpace was, I'm not kidding here, a shortcut to a webpage.  

The webpage is since gone, as the developers abandoned this "game".   While they did run it, it was just a browser/flash game, and to try drum up support for that garbage, they paid $100 to post a shortcut to their webpage as if it was a game itself on Steam. 

Now I've seen everything.  Anyway, dead browser game, don't waste any time downloading this.

review: Только не так давно негодовал, что в стиме болтаются мёртвые игры. И вот тебе на. Не ожидал, что так быстро наткнусь на такой же недобиток. При запуске у вас не только игра не открывается, но вас отправят в браузер, на страницу, которая уже не существует. Вот как так? В чистках, значит удаляют массу игр, среди, которых есть вполне достойные продукты, а неработающие огрызки оставляют... Не комильфо!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6897, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1531674125}
review:
BattleSpace-это научно-фантастическая флеш-игра, предназначенная для игры в комфорте вашего веб-браузера. В этой бесплатной онлайн-стратегии вы вступаете в роль адмирала, строящего Солнечную систему в глубинах далекой галактики. Каждый игрок начинает в своем собственном "Союзе", или гильдии, с возможностью объединиться и создать межзвездную империю.

Играйте Соло, PvE, PvP, как боец или собиратель—или все вышеперечисленное! Варианты безграничны, как только вы весь глубокий космос. Конечная цель состоит в том, чтобы завоевать гигантскую планету до конца сезона, но с таким количеством способов добраться туда, портные BattleSpace для всех стилей игры.

10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2464, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1495449453}
review:

아래의 게임 설명에도 있군요. play in the comfort of your web browser.

실행을 하면 인터넷 브라우저가 뜨면서 게임 사이트로 이동됩니다.
문제는 로딩이 상당히 느립니다. 로딩되서 플레이를 눌렀지만.... 
10분째 검은 화면 상태에서 반응이 없군요.
20분 드디어 사운드가 나오면서 화면이 변했다. 하지만 변화가 없다. 
새로고침 - >검은 화면 반응 없음

웹 브라우저라 그런지, 스팀 플레이 타임도 변하지 않습니다.
평가를 쓰기위해 실행하고 종료하고를 반복해야한다니....

author: {'steamid': '76561198211699983', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1582097932}
review:
【経緯】
私が今までやったブラウザゲームの中で最も楽しかった(楽しいではない)ゲームです。確実に。このゲームはもともとエンタークルーズという日本のゲームメーカーが提供していたゲームですが、2016年にサービスを終了しましたが、生き残っていた欧州サーバーが、ゲームの普及を目指してSteamに公開したんです。Steam上で起動できるゲームではなく、あくまでブラウザゲームです。

【ゲーム内容】
あなたはステラマスター(一惑星の統治者)です。さらなる覇権拡大を目指すため、あなたは周囲の資源惑星や前哨基地のために小惑星、そしてプレイヤーの惑星を。
統治下の惑星の内政やプレイヤーとの外交を駆使して、さらなる軍事力の拡大を目指し、宇宙の頂点を目指しましょう。

【特徴】
このゲームはとにかプレイヤーとの協力がとても大切です。一人でも遊べないことはないですが、プレイヤー同士との方がかなり面白いです。プレイヤーが少ないのは、この類のゲームには致命傷。ですがSteamに掲載されているので、プレイヤーが増えるて活気が戻るのを、(5年間やっている)者として切に願います。

ディスカバリーキューにこれが出てきたらとりあえず、やってみよう！

author: {'steamid': '76561197982295752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2097, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1467486992}
review:
BattleSpace is a free to play web browser Flash game.  It worked, looked ok, sounded ok, played ok, was understandable in English.  
CONS:  This is a Click and Wait game, Takes increasing amount of real time to increase stats or do anything. 
The User Interface is confusing and cluttered.
 It has a long tutorial, but is confusing and easy to forget.  
The game uses only the lowest resolution playing field, no way to make it larger. 
 It is a multiplayer game, so you might be PVPing. 
 Very boring, very time consuming.  

 The only reason to play this game is if you computer cannot handle better games.  
Try it, if you only have an Old computer and you don't speak English.   Do NOT spend real money on this game. 

For more info;
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-J9tV051XnQ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xke7KCiuVxA

http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/battlespace

http://www.gamewatcher.com/games/battlespace/news

http://www.gamezebo.com/2012/05/31/battlespace-review/

author: {'steamid': '76561198173683283', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 46836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27078, 'last_played': 1667689054}
review:
I actually really enjoyed this game. There's so much tactics, research, resource gathering, taking over entire systems. At one point, i got drunk and started a war over a missunderstanding. Two of the biggest galactic unions got involved and the fighting was absolutely relentless and brutal basically the entire galaxy became aligned to 2-3 unions and widespread civil war broke out because of a drunken missunderstanding. It lasted months. The fighting got so intense, people were booking days off work just to stay up all night and defend their unions. One person spent about 50 quid upgrading the stuff in game for better offensive capabilities due to an attack from my tier 5 ships. During this my tiny union put up such a fight came in 3rd in the world for offense and defence for that month. 

This game is extremely tactical. For example, some battles you're up against a fight so heavy, there is no way on earth you can win it, so you need to beat a tactical retreat. You can do this by taking back systems as you leave, and the enemy can't progress through a system unless they own the system connected to the target system in its entirety. However taking a planet in a system uses up a flag, and also puts the planet under protection for an hour or so. It's also nice when you're retreating to leave some extremely powerful fleets and commanders fortifying occupied planets. When they come and take the planet, they get ambused and when they find that the stars ran red with their blood, they'll send everything they've got to that planet, a good policy then is to recall your fleets while their sorties are coming to attack the now unoccupied planet, this wastes their sortie points and leaves them wide open to a counter attack. 

A good tactic when you are being attacked, is to create a swamp of dozens of partially occupied systems around your homeworld system. Slowing down the enemy unions attack to crawl, hopefully giving you enough time to setup a defence. You have to be careful though each sortie whether successful or not takes time, and uses up action points on your commanders, and you only have so many action points. You also have a finite number of ships (although this is upgradable in the game). There will be times when you are playing this game, where you've found an equally matched enemy, and you've used up all your best ships, and you're both throwing improvised ships at each other, basically amounting to throwing mud and dirt in a frantic battle to death. 

You want commanders who command large numbers of ships to be most effective. You upgrade commanders by fusing them together, losing a commander in the process, you can also raise the rank of your commander through fusing. There's different types of fusing, there's level fusing and skill fusing. You also get champion points which can be used to buy better commanders in the game. 

In terms of the ships, there's dozens, with variable capabilities, and these will be altered by the quality of the commander, the commander's capabilities, your foes, the formation of the commander, and the relative strengths of your union versus the enemy union. 

There have been times when i've rolled up into a conflict using cheap fully Tier 1 hyperdrive ships (very fast but poorly armed and armoured ships) and wiped out a number of large heavily armed Tier2 ships, simply because of the choice of formation, weapons capability, and commander. 

In this game, big dicks and powerful weapons mean absolutely nothing unless they are backed up with very careful tactics.

You do need to be part of a union. And you need to go and grab the nearest astroid, and astroids work as military bases in this game because the distances involved are insane, and attacks just don't work unless they are coordinated with teammates. Once you have captured a 'roid, and it's fortified by your union mates, you can relax a little. Although that didn't work for me, one season, i spawned in the middle of the Tartarus empire. I was knee deep in Tarts, and my prospects looked grim. Someone actually looked at where i was, and said that i was like Rambo, deep behind enemy lines fighting battles on 3-4 fronts simultaneously. Yeah, that was a rough season that was. Luckily after several weeks of bitter fighting, our unions merged into one of the top 3 unions in the galaxy. When that happens, you just have bury the hatchet and work together. Because there's always some greasy bastard trying to steal parts of your empire and you need all the help you can get keeping the savages at bay. There's also frequent diplomatic "incidents" where a union member (usually new) doesn't understand political protocol or their military capabilities, decides to get all brave and takes on an enemy, not realising that they are one of the most powerful union presidents in the galaxy... These situations are where the political tactics come into play. 

Also another feature of this game is, powerful unions are one thing, but sometimes they are part of even more powerful collectives who go around conquoring smaller unions. Until you're part of a larger union, it's not always clear what the power hierachies are. You also sometimes get spies in your union, people with the inside dirt on tactics, you've got to be careful out there. 

Most of the time it's about strategically managing resources so that you and your union produce a huge armada. There are regular events where the entire galaxy unit against alien invaders. I can't remember what they are called now. 

TL;DR:

Getting drunk and destablising the delicate political balance of the top 5 unions, so that the entire galaxy plunges into widespread civil war is priceless. 

For everything else, there's fully upgraded Tier 5 Ganymede ships, carefully supplemented by Tier 3 destroyers, torpedo and plasma ships.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105680429', 'num_games_owned': 5132, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1451752174}
review: 卧槽。。。。游戏下载好就是个网站快捷链接图标。。。。steam上打开游戏就直接跳出网页，也就是这游戏就是页游。。。。然后steam就不显示你在玩这个游戏，差不多就是你玩这页游steam上不计算你玩这个的游戏时间。。。。搞不懂steam为什么会有这个游戏，这游戏挂在steam商店我估计就是宣传链接，对了这游戏有集卡，必须要在游戏里消费道具才会给你集卡。。。。游戏差评，游戏合出来的背景和表情好评，估计很多人不玩这游戏基本都去合卡了。。。。。为了写这个评测，打开游戏凑时间就好几次。。。。

How to go Hulk in 5 easy steps:
- Install the game FROM STEAM
- Click play FROM STEAM
- Wait to see a browser window open OUTSIDE STEAM
- Click the huge "play now" button
- Watch a "register page" load WITHOUT A STEAM ACCOUNT OPTION

review: Very slow, cant resize the window, Tier 2 to Tier 3 research takes 34 - 72 hours and that only one.  No action sequences, it is all PVP because even if you wanted to only play PVE someone can come in a raid you.  It is simular to OGAME you can just see your battles now. author: {'steamid': '76561198015389661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 30126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14935, 'last_played': 1709388828}
review:
Battlespace is deep. It has provided me with months of entertainment and a place to meet cool, intelligent people. It's slow paced, which is perfect for me and highly dependent on strategy the higher level you get. The events are well spaced to let you grow in between the Invasions, but not so far apart to get boring for a patient person. 

This game requires a lot of thought and patience, but the payoff in higher level PVP and Giant Planet raids is worth the wait. Finding a good Union is key (SPEED IS KEY, JACK) as is getting your resource production up and keeping it flowing.

Overall, the stability and deep gameplay of Battlespace make up for it being a browser game which is, in my opinion, it's only deficit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083523024', 'num_games_owned': 2466, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1423947476}
review:
I don't mind this type of games, I really don't. This particular game though, should not be on Steam... at least not in this form.
It's not about quality in this case, in fact, it does look rather well made... But it was not properly ported to the Steam, heck, it wasn't ported at all.
All this is, is just a link redirecting you to the browser.

If I would want to play browser games in the browser... I would use the browser in the first place. I don't need Steam to open the browser for me, thank you very much.

If they would made a game client for the Steam, I would be all for it. Otherwise, it shouldn't even be here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050843268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19681, 'last_played': 1423326154}

P.S. A differenza dei giochi del suo genere in BattleSpace è difficile che tu esaurica tutte le risorse ([u] punto a favore [/u])

author: {'steamid': '76561198017367587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1421494242}
review:
[h1]VERSION COURTE [/h1]

Je n'ai pas eu de problème pour me connecter avec Steam. Le site propose une connexion directe avec son compte.
Une fois que vous êtes connecté, vous pouvez jouer en toute tranquillité … Ce jeu à l’air génial … en tout cas, la barre de chargement l’était … bref ... après avoir passé 5 minutes à attendre que cette barre arrive à 100%, vous voilà dans le jeu ... ou pas ... 
Vous devez sélectionner votre commandant parmi une sélection de skin féminin qui vous rappellera sans doute divers jeu de rencontre japonnais ...
Ensuite vous cliquez un peu partout (parce que ça commence à vous énerver et vous avez envie de jouer un peu quand même...) et vous voilà sur l'interface du jeu ...
et c'est la cata ... interface bien trop petite et trop encombrée, votre commandant qui vous mp toute les deux secondes sans en connaitre la raison. Un jeu qui se transformera finalement en simulation de colère plus qu'autre chose ... Un jeu qui n’a sans doute rien à faire sur Steam.

[table]
[tr]
[td]
--------------  EVALUATION EDITÉE DU [i] 17/21/2015 [/i] BY [i] [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/SSeika] SEIKA [/url] [/i] --------------
[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759830', 'num_games_owned': 3051, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1421406401}
review:
I don't know why this game is on steam
It's a normal oldschool Flash Browsergame.
It downloads nothing because if you take it to your library you only get a shortcut which opens a Browserwindow. Then you can login with steam (over the steam website login plugin) and play like a normal browsergame.
The game itself only launches in a little window in the browser, around it is a website with "buy credits", news and so on.
I think if you want to play it its not important if you play it out of the steam library or direct input the URL in the browserwindow.
It looks like a cheap handy game and i've seen much oldschool browsergames but this is one of the cheapes in the flash system i've ever seen.
Games like this should not be usable over steam because there is nothing, no achievements, no cards and the steamlogin you can also use if you directly go to the website.

Ihr sucht weitere Rezessionen, Spieletest, Gameplay Videos und ähnliches? Dann schaut doch mal in unserer Gruppe vorbei.

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/GandVtest

author: {'steamid': '76561198003785049', 'num_games_owned': 4805, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1422224313}
review:
BattleSpace sin lugar a duda me ha hecho volver a la edad de los juegos de navegador y siendo sincero lo estoy jugando. En mi juventud me dedique a jugar mucho tiempo a ogame, tribal wars (guerras tribales en la actualidad) o bitefight. Sin lugar a dudas juegos como estos fomentaron no solo la inteligencia de muchas personas sino que ayudo a los usuarios a trabajar en "compañerismo", siendo imposible así jugar solo ya que te enfrentaras a clanes de jugadores bien preparados y coordinados como un equipo para acabar contigo.

Hay mucha gente que criticara este juego, pero es por que ni tienen ni idea de jugabilidad grupal (ya que estaras obligado a unirte a un clan "UNION") para poder avanzar contra el resto de jugadores.

Y lo mas importante de todo es el lenguaje complejo de programación que tiene detras, que supera a muchos juegos actuales, horas de programación se han dedicado los desarrolladores en desarrollar este juego, hay esta mi voto positivo ya que desarrollar un juego de navegador consume mucho tiempo y causa dolores de cabeza (Lo dice alguien que ha estudiado y ha diseñado paginas webs y ha montado su propio host con XAMPP en su propio pc)

Los lenguajes que han usado son estos: html5, css5, java script, php5 y adobe flash que le da seguridad al cargar las diversas páginas que lo componen mas una base de datos bien ajustada a php con la que tranfiere en tiempo real cantidad de conexiones con la web gestionando todos las necesidades del usuario dentro del juego.

Pero bueno dando mi valoración rutinaria haya va (y que conste que esta gente han puesto un free to play el cual tiene un esqueleto de programación complejo no como por ejemplo los call of duty que te venden una y otra vez el mismo sistema de programación repetitivo de mata... mata.... mata .... con el cuchillo de un golpe en el talon de aquiles...)

Lo bueno:
-Esta en español
-Tiene tutorial de como aprender a jugar
-Union libre (puedes unirte a la union de cualquier jugador que quiera hacer un clan libre o privada o crear la tuya propia)
-Tiene cantidad de opciones funcionales que dejan a viejos juegos de navegador como Ogame bastante desfasados
-Lo desarrolla una compañia a la que aprecio mucho por su conocido juego de ps3 "DRAGON CROWN" (me encanta la maga >w<) y no esperaba menos que en este juego de navegador metiera algo de su propio art anime (ojala metan el dragon crown en steam me sacaria los cromos por tal de tener a la maga de fondo de perfil >w<)
-Lo comentado anteriormente, mucha programación y diseño en adobe que aprecio fundamentalmente por que el grupo de programadores le han dedicado mucho mucho tiempo a desarrollarlo (a diferencia de otros que ya venden el sistema una y otra vez ya desarrollado como comente anteriormente)
-Sistema de batallas por oleadas (un clasico y interesante ya que si pierdes flotas el enemigo tiene mas posibilidades de ganar en las siguientes oleadas)
-Investigación complejas =levea naves, bases, incluso los propios personajes animes que tendras como almirantes de tu gran colonia
-Coloniza y conquista a tus adversarios usandolos como granjas.
-Una banda sonora bastante tranquila y futurista y no es muy repetetiva aunque la escuches varias veces (es como la musica de los centro comerciales que ni te enteras que esta hay)
-Algunas configuraciones interesantes para mejorar el juego y algo importante que steam protege tu cuenta de posibles virus de navegador (gusanos o troyanos) que puedan filtrar tus datos a un usuario maligno externo
-chat dividido en varios apartados para hablar privado, general, o union (clan)

PD: Recomendable jugar con gente, montar un clan y ir escalando posiciones.

Negativo:
-El sistema esta muy sobrecargado con flash, yo juego con mi portatil y muchas veces mi firefox tiende a ralentizarse ya que al depender de un ordenador que tiene plugins, marcadores, cookies y demas hace que con tantos recursos tarde en  poder disfrutar del juego
-Muchas opciones, cuesta trabajo incluso con el tutorial adaptarse a la cantidad de opciones que trae el juego, es decir memorizarlas.

Puntuación total: 8,7 

Y al que no le guste mi explicación que se vaya a roer cables con el resto de niños ratas ocultos. xD

PD: Lo bonito de los juegos de navegador es que no tienes que instalar nada. Ni parches, ni dlcs, ni nada de nada todo se actualiza desde el host web y lo mejor de todo es que al ser un juego no compilado con un launcher instalador puedes modificar el juego todas las veces que te de la gana teniendo un conocimiento de programación web basico asi que animo a todos los desarrolladores web a hacer juegos free to play de este tipo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065003768', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1421342241}
review:
Jakim cudem to trafiło na Steama? ta "niby" gra to tylko maleńki pliczek wykonywalny .exe który jedynie co robi to otwiera ci stronę gry w przeglądarce. Pieprzeni twórcy tego badziewia robią se tylko reklamę na Steam

author: {'steamid': '76561198122496710', 'num_games_owned': 1905, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1421331483}
review:
[h1] Скучный космос [/h1]

Очередная браузерная MMO-стратегия сделанная на флеше в sci-fi антураже. Я не знаю, зачем стим устанавливает ее на хард, если запускается она все равно в браузере.

По описанию игра выходит довольно занятная, но это только по описанию. 
На деле BattleSpace - это чрезвычайно скучная игра. Меня она успела утомить уже на обучении. 

Не могу взять в толк, почему разрабы сделали такое маленькое игровое поле, которое располагается в центре экрана. Это реально бесит, если учесть, что полезное пространство отъедает еще и интерфейс игры. Больше раздражает только музыкальное сопровождение, которое состоит из одной зацикленной мелодии, надоедающей уже через пару минут.

Ах да. Без доната здесь тоже не обошлось. Хочешь быстро построить здание или завершить исследование? Плати бабло. Захотел больше и быстрей нанять адмиралов? Деньги на бочку!

Таким играм самое место только в Фейсбуке или Вконтаче, но уж точно не в Стиме. Хватит давать зеленый свет всякому хламу.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998597178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1689911105}
review:
Its a basic browser game, yes theres a ton of those and yes its nothing that new, but  so are all the mmo's on steam, also keep in mind it was very popular on the old NA servers, and still is on non NA servers, so a big part is just the players on here i suppose. 

 Its free, and you can play the game without playing a dime and do well, it takes a while at first but evetually you will speed up. 

 I played this game for a year and a half when atlus hosted it, and i loved playing it as long as i was in a guild, so i would recomend you join one to fully enjoy the game.


Edit, found out a i could edit to fix a typo, ONE typo i had, no nead to make fun of it guys, as well as to clarify something i had said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045712329', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1420918957}
review:
this is a click and wait game strategy and thought not needed.

it realy is only a facebook game. there is no strategy or need for it this game has no play value past point click wait 10 seconds up to 10 mins. i do not know if the wait times go over 10 mins since that is when i closed the game. 

a huge con of this game is every time you open it you have to log into steam and be sent an access code every time.

to simplify what the game is you build your little village on a planet then hours later of click and wait you can make another little village on another planet. the is no real way to loose the "campaign"  because you can quit playing for days or years and come back at the same point you left. pvp is a joke in this the game controls you and your foe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048654252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1751, 'last_played': 1422801576}
review:
Even though I do enjoy this game and based on what little I have played, I think it would be very enjoyable for years to come. However, its obviously not going to be for everyone. To get started, there are a few major problems right off the bat.

1) This game will constantly crash when attempting to launch the browser, forcing you to try it multiple times before getting to the sign in page.

2) For me, my antivirus (AVG) kicks in at this point telling me its a threat, asking me to block it or add it to the exceptions list. (every time) The threats are flagged with both "behavioral detection" and "identity protection"

3) after you manage to actually sign in and get around your antivirus, when clicking the play button there is a high probability it will crash yet again. Once it is finally loaded it is stable.

It is getting very frustrating to say the lest, and there are other things that annoyed me as well such as an "incomplete tutorial" that doesn't cover many key features. And a "worthless wiki page" not to mention there was a large number of minor bugs that I found in the short 7 hours I been playing.

As it stands right now I just can't recommending it to anyone.

Edit: The antivirus AVG is causing a large number (if not all) of the crashes and disabling it for 10 min is the only way to log into the game.

review: Not really sure where this game is going. Takes about 5 tries every time to get logged in without errors. When you finally log in it is nowhere near as good as it is written up to be in the summary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038963412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1420795954}
review:
1/10
Oh boy, yet another FB game, but this time on Steam!
THis charmless and unoriginal game claims to be a sci-fi flash game designed to play in the comfort of your web browser. If that's comfort, these guys must be very sick indeed. The annoying music loops and will cause you to turn it off after your first tutorial mission "Click on a patch of your base, click build a thing, wait 30 seconds" (as if you didn't already know that's what it would be.) And the player interaction consisted of a chat box full of people asking if anybody knew how to make the game use a decent amount of available monitor (Nobody did)
